page.title: 20Local issues.
page.content: Our area is a rural one and the inhabitants are anxious that its character should not be altered. However,in the past few years a series of new mine shafts have been sunk, which together form Britain's newest and most modern coal field. Residents in Escrick were adamant that they did not want the nearest shaft to be named after their village;it was therefore named the North Selby Shaft.Farmers anticipate problems with water flow when extraction of coal begins in the near future.The village is concerned that new housing developments should be kept to the East of the A19,and that when planning permission is granted for new houses,the quantity and quality is appropriate to the existing size and amenities of the village.Hopefully,our area will never be just an extension of York or Selby.
